pokemon.name: Bulbasaur
pokemon.flavorText: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this POKéMON.

pokemon.name: Ivysaur
pokemon.flavorText: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

pokemon.name: Venusaur
pokemon.flavorText: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

pokemon.name: Charmander
pokemon.flavorText: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

pokemon.name: Charmeleon
pokemon.flavorText: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.

pokemon.name: Charizard
pokemon.flavorText: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.

pokemon.name: Squirtle
pokemon.flavorText: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

pokemon.name: Wartortle
pokemon.flavorText: Often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

pokemon.name: Blastoise
pokemon.flavorText: A brutal POKéMON with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles.

pokemon.name: Caterpie
pokemon.flavorText: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

pokemon.name: Metapod
pokemon.flavorText: This POKéMON is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

pokemon.name: Butterfree
pokemon.flavorText: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

pokemon.name: Weedle
pokemon.flavorText: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp venomous stinger on its head.

pokemon.name: Kakuna
pokemon.flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this POKéMON can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

pokemon.name: Beedrill
pokemon.flavorText: Flies at high speed and attacks using its large venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

pokemon.name: Pidgey
pokemon.flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

pokemon.name: Pidgeotto
pokemon.flavorText: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this POKéMON will fiercely peck at any intruder.

pokemon.name: Pidgeot
pokemon.flavorText: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as MAGIKARP.

pokemon.name: Rattata
pokemon.flavorText: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

pokemon.name: Raticate
pokemon.flavorText: It uses its whis­ kers to maintain its balance. It apparently slows down if they are cut off.

pokemon.name: Spearow
pokemon.flavorText: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.

pokemon.name: Fearow
pokemon.flavorText: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

pokemon.name: Ekans
pokemon.flavorText: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds, such as PIDGEY and SPEAROW, whole.

pokemon.name: Arbok
pokemon.flavorText: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.

pokemon.name: Pikachu
pokemon.flavorText: When several of these POKéMON gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.
